Generation I.Red: This Pok é mon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: This Pok é mon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
Generation I.Yellow: Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
Generation I.Stadium: When it hardens, only the external shell is transformed. The inside remains tender.

Generation II.Gold: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve . It stays motionless in the shell.
Generation II.Silver: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.
Generation II.Crystal: This is its pre-evolved form. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: The shell covering this Pok é mon 's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
Generation III.Sapphire: The shell covering this Pok é mon 's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
Generation III.Emerald: Its shell is as hard as an iron slab. A Metapod does not move very much because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the shell.
Generation III.FireRed: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.
Generation III.LeafGreen: This Pok é mon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

Generation IV.Diamond: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation IV.Pearl: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation IV.Platinum: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.

Generation V.Black: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.White: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.Black 2: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.White 2: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

Generation VI.X: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation VI.Y: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The shell covering this Pokémon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: The shell covering this Pokémon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.

Generation VII.Sun: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
Generation VII.Moon: Its shell is hard, but it's still just a bug shell. It's been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its hard shell doesn't crack a bit even if Pikipek pecks at it, but it will tip over, spilling out its insides.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.

Generation VIII.Sword: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
Generation VIII.Shield: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. The Pokémon quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. The Pokémon quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
